alert.note: Alert for Jones; Linn (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 16 at 3:01PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CST FOR SOUTHWESTERN JONES AND SOUTHEASTERN LINN COUNTIES... At 301 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Paralta, or 9 miles east of Cedar Rapids, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Paralta around 305 PM CST. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Springville. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Motorists should not take shelter under highway overpasses. If you cannot safely drive away from the tornado, as a last resort, either park your vehicle and stay put, or abandon your vehicle and lie down in a low lying area and protect yourself from flying debris. This storm has a history of producing tornadoes. Seek shelter now!
